discoveredAssets: localhost:8080 - Main Web Application (Apache 2.4.65, Bootstrap 5.3.0-alpha1) - Port 8080
/login - Form-based authentication endpoint with client-side validation only
/resource - Resource loader endpoint with filename parameter (potential path traversal)
/static - Static files directory with directory listing enabled
/static/flag - Suspicious flag file protected with 403 Forbidden
HTTP Methods: GET, POST, HEAD, OPTIONS supported on authentication endpoints

targets.objective: Test authentication bypass vulnerabilities: SQL injection in username/password fields, NoSQL injection attacks, default credentials (admin/admin, admin/password, etc.), client-side bypass techniques, brute force resistance, session management flaws, credential enumeration, and error message information disclosure
targets.rationale: Critical CVSS entry point - form-based authentication with client-side validation only. Always displays error message. No visible rate limiting or account lockout. Potential for brute force and injection attacks.

targets.objective: Test file inclusion and path traversal: path traversal (../, ..\), URL encoding bypass (%2e%2e), double encoding, null byte injection, unicode bypass (%c0%ae), backslash bypass, verify blacklist bypasses, test for arbitrary file read (/etc/passwd, /etc/shadow, application config files), and information disclosure
targets.rationale: HIGH risk endpoint - accepts filename parameter and loads resources dynamically. Some payloads already return 404, but bypasses may exist. Could lead to source code disclosure or system file access.

targets.objective: Test directory traversal, enumerate all files in directories, attempt to access /static/flag file by bypassing 403 restriction, test for path traversal to access parent directories or sensitive files, verify directory listing restrictions, and check for backup files (.bak, .old, ~)
targets.rationale: MEDIUM risk - Directory listing enabled reveals application structure. Flag file is protected but accessible path exists. Directory traversal might bypass restrictions.

targets.objective: Test for authentication bypass to access protected endpoints after login, CSRF attacks on login form, XSS in error messages, session fixation, cookie manipulation, test all HTTP methods (PUT, DELETE, PATCH), and verify redirect chain logic
targets.rationale: Root endpoint redirects to /login. After bypassing authentication, may lead to protected functionality discovery. Test for logical flaws in authentication flow.

targets.objective: Infrastructure testing: Test for default Apache configurations, HTTPOnly/Secure cookie flags, HSTS headers, X-Frame-Options for clickjacking, CSP headers, test for known Apache 2.4.65 vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-XXXXX), verify error page information disclosure
targets.rationale: Apache 2.4.65 on Debian may have known vulnerabilities. Check security headers configuration and server-level protections.

keyFindings: [CRITICAL] Client-side only form validation on /login - form submission prevented by JavaScript preventDefault(), no server-side validation visible
[HIGH] Directory listing enabled on /static/, /static/css/, /static/js/ - reveals application structure and file names
[HIGH] /resource endpoint with filename parameter - accepts filesystem paths, potential path traversal vulnerability (some payloads blocked but bypasses may exist)
[HIGH] Suspicious 'flag' file exists at /static/flag but returns 403 Forbidden - indicates sensitive protected content
[MEDIUM] Authentication form always displays 'Incorrect username or password' error message regardless of input - may enable username enumeration
[MEDIUM] No visible rate limiting on login attempts - vulnerable to brute force attacks
[MEDIUM] Server reveals Apache 2.4.65 and Debian information in headers - version disclosure
[LOW] No CORS headers detected - may prevent cross-origin requests but needs verification
[LOW] Application redirects root (/) to /login with 302 redirect - standard authentication flow but potential for redirect bypasses
